result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Freson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:00pm [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies receipt and review of the Victim Impact Statement

ADA Hall indicates that the victim and his mother would like to address the Court
Victim makes a statement to the Court
Mother of Victim makes a statement to the Court

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1: to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
--On Count #2: to serve 4 months in the Jefferson County Jail, this is to be served consecutive to Count #1, with Huber privileges
--On Count #3: to serve 5 months in the Jefferson County Jail, this is to be served consecutive to Counts #1 and #2, with Huber privileges
 --0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Freson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence  with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay $254 in subpoena fees

The total costs/fee of all counts, $1,583 is to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 9/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 32  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 2:00pm

Case called at 3:26pm [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits a Victim Impact Statement; notes that the victim is present in the courtroom

DA Happ submits an Amended Information
--arguments given by DA Happ
--The Court grants the motion to amend the Information as now before the Court

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #1, #2, #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Attorney Rhiel requests that Sentencing occur on a later date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Freson. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

recess: 3:46pm

NEXT: Sentencing on 12/3/15 at 11:15am
Conflict Review Worksheet--No Conflict Found; A record was not made on this date, the Clerk noted on calendar for the next hearing to do so

Case called at 1:01pm [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

As to the State's Motion to Impeach Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications:
--No factual objections
--Arguments given by Counsel
--For the purposes of Trial, Mr. Freson has 4 prior convictions

As to the Defense's Motion to Impeach the Witness with Prior Convictions:
--No factual objections
--For purposes of Trial, the witness, BG, has 3 prior conviction

As to the State's Motion in Limine:
--All paragraphs of the Motion are granted

As The Defendant's Response to the State's Notice to Admit Statements:
--Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. Rhiel gives clarification
--The Court finds that the Statements that the State requests are admissible and grants the State's request
--The Court denies the request of the Defense to Admit all text messages between the defendant and victim

As to the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Certified Medical Records:
--With no objection, the Court grants this request

The Court and Counsel discuss procedural matters of Trial:
-- No alternate
-- 4 strikes for each party
--jurors are allowed to ask questions
--State's Jury Instructions are proper at this time
recess: 1:37pm
Motion to impeach a witness with prior convictions

Defendant's response to scheduling order
Defendant's reply to State's motion to admit defendant's statements
Defendant's response to the State's motions in limine
Defendant's response to the State's motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions
Motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
Notice of intent to admit certified medical records

Case called at 10:06am [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Rhiel indicates that this case will likely resolve before trial, requests an additional status conference.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court distributes its scheduling order.
recess: 10:10am

NEXT: 1)FSSC on 11/16/15 at 3:00pm 2)Jury Trial on 11/19/15 at 8:30am
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing held on March 30, 2015 before the Honorable Judge Wambach

Case called at 8:20am [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Rhiel indicates that he is newly appointed to the case and has not had a opportunity to meet with prosecutor assigned to this case; further Atty. Rhiel requests a Pretrial and Status Conference.
DA Happ indicates that the prosecutor assigned to the case is unavailable for formal pretrial conferences until September and suggests Atty. Rhiel and the prosecutor set up an informal Pretrial.
The Court and Atty. Rhiel agree with this suggestion.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess: 8:25am

NEXT: (1)Informal Pretrial Conference--to be scheduled between Atty. Rhiel and Atty. Beck (2) Status Conference: September 8, 2015 at 9:30am
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 3:13 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing)
[Court reporter: Lisa Zinda]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney Matthew Russell Meyer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Meyer orally motions to withdraw from case, presents basis
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Freson informs the Court that he joins in motion to withdraw
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Victims are present - Statements by Lynn Grulke
off-record: 3:15 - 3:18 pm for ADA Hall to speak with victim
ADA Hall informs the Court that victim was hoping matter would proceed today; reluctantly would agree to adjourn
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Meyer presents issues/breakdown in relationship
Court reviews right to counsel/constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.

Court orders as further condition of Mr. Freson's bond:
--to report to SPD today regarding eligibility
Court presents basis, allows Atty Meyer to withdraw and sets matter for STC
Court informs Mr. Freson that It will not adjourn the 7/14/15 STC date for private counsel; with trial dates to be set quickly
Recess: 3:35 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 7/14/15 at 8:15 am - Send notices
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Case called at 9:42am [mo]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney Matthew Meyer.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Officer Ryan Abbott--Sworn and Testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Meyer  

Arguments given by Attorney Meyer
Atty. Meyer orally motions for dismissal and gives brief argument, The Court denies the Motion. 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Freson committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts

Atty. Meyer requests a Plea and Sentencing date out 90 days, to allow Mr. Freson to undergo Anger Management. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.
No objection from ADA Beck on the delay of the Plea and Sentencing date. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling  
recess: 10:05am  

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing: 6/30/15 at 3:00pm ((allow 1 hour))
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:13am [MO & MK]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney Matthew Meyer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Meyer indicates that he has not recieved an offer from the State Mr. Freson is willing to accept, and requests a Preliminary Hearing date.
ADA Shock indicates victim rights are complied.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. Atty. Meyer indicates his first availability is in late March.
Mr. Freson verifies the Clement St. address is correct.
Recess: 10:17am

NEXT:   Preliminary Hearing 3/30/2015 at 9:00am
Status conference on February 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

case called at 1:08pm. [MK]
Defendant Justin J. Freson in court with Attorney Matthew R Meyer.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Meyer indicates that the address listed for Mr. Freson on the Criminal Complaint is current.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no direct or indirect contact with Brett Grulke
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Jodi Zimmerman
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol ; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:11pm. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/21/15 at 3:00pm.    (2) case is referred to Branch III for scheduling (case is at Preliminary Hearing stage)
for continuance of the 11/25/14 Initial Appearance
Initial appearance on December 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 11/25/14 Initial Appearance
